title: 'Unprecedented' flooding in France is expected to last all week
subhead: With most of the country still on flood alert, a new storm system arriving from Brittany is set to impact France on Wednesday and Thursday, bringing another bout of heavy rainfall and winds.

title: Jesse Jackson, pastor and civil rights icon, dies at 84
French prosecutors intervene in defense of TotalEnergies in climate trial
Six suspects sought in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
subhead: The prosecutor detailed the violent incident that led to the death of young far-right activist Quentin Deranque. Meanwhile, accusations against antifascist activists have spread through far-right online networks.

title: At Navalny's grave, two years after his death in a Russian prison: 'We are not alone'
subhead: Several hundred supporters of the Kremlin's most renowned opponent gathered on Monday at the Moscow cemetery where he is buried. A new investigation confirmed the cause of his death: assassination by poisoning.

title: Chinese kung-fu robots steal the show in world's most-watched TV program
subhead: Watched by 600 million viewers, the annual gala broadcast by national television channel CCTV for Lunar New Year's Eve serves as a showcase for China's advances in robotics and artificial intelligence.

title: Who owns second homes in France?
subhead: Owners of second homes are not a homogeneous group. They include retirees, professionals and investors, reflecting changing ways of living and challenging the organization of local communities.

title: Diplomat Anne-Claire Legendre succeeds Jack Lang at Arab World Institute
The Epstein case: Thirty years of judicial negligence, at the expense of victims
France releases Russian oil tanker intercepted near Marseille
EU opens investigation into Shein over sale of childlike sex dolls
Hillary Clinton accuses Trump of orchestrating Epstein 'cover-up'
Gabriella Karefa-Johnson, a New York fashion provocateur styling Serena Williams and NYC's first lady
Ireland's data protection watchdog opens EU probe into Grok sexual AI imagery
Baby treated in utero for rare vascular tumor in medical first
French music festivals to book for late winter and early spring
Eleni Glykatzi-Ahrweiler, prominent Byzantist and first female rector of the Sorbonne, dies at 99
Robert Duvall, singular figure of New Hollywood, has died
Frederick Wiseman, legendary American documentary filmmaker, dies at 96
How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: 'Wuthering Heights': A 'dark romance' swept away by Margot Robbie
subhead: Emerald Fennell draws on Emily Brontë's novel to unravel a series of vignettes punctuated by erotic scenes in which the actress dominates the screen.

title: In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhead: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: Rejecting political violence
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
'Donald Trump floods the political and media landscape, even in France, where domestic issues suddenly seem trivial'
